newsitem.title: POLAND: OPEL PLANS TO ENTER POLISH MINICAR MARKET - PAPER.
newsitem.headline: OPEL PLANS TO ENTER POLISH MINICAR MARKET - PAPER.

text.p: Adam Opel AG will start production at its Polish plant with a small family car but will follow through shortly with a launch of a new mini car, Opel's chief executive David Herman told Rzeczpospolita newspaper.

Reczpospolita quoted Herman as saying that Opel, the German subsidiary of General Motors, wanted to launch a new model that would be smaller and 20 percent cheaper than its Corsa sub-compact and would compete with Fiat's Cinquecento minicar.
"We want to attack Poland's Cinquecento market," Herman said.
"Cars that sell the best in Poland are the small and cheap ones and we are working on such cars right now," he added.
Herman said Opel expected to sell its new models in Poland and to export them to other East and Central European countries.
Opel launched the construction of its Polish 470-million mark plant last month and expects first family cars based on its current Astra model to roll off its assembly lines in 1998.
